channel.title: hospitality on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in hospitality on Logotyp.us

item.title: Baymont
item.description: Baymont Inn & Suites is a hotel franchise owned by Wyndham Hotels & Resorts and based in the United States. As of December 31, 2018, it has 513 properties with 40,541 rooms. Source

item.title: Best Western
item.description: Best Western International, Inc. owns the Best Western Hotels & Resorts brand, which it licenses to over 4,500 hotels worldwide. The franchise, with its corporate headquarters in Phoenix, Arizona, includes more than 2,000 hotels in North America. The brand was founded by M.K. Guertin in 1946. As of May 2019, David Kong is the president and CEO of Best Western and Dorothy Dowling is the chief marketing officer. Source Source

item.title: Dazzler
item.description: Featuring sleek decor and exceptional service, Dazzler Hotels represent an exciting synthesis of comfort and functional aesthetics. Centrally located in some of Latin America’s most vibrant neighborhoods, Dazzler offers easy access to local hotspots and top attractions. Source

item.title: Dolce
item.description: Dolce Hotels and Resorts’ awe-inspiring locations provide imaginative environments for guests to connect, create, and discover. State-of-the-art meeting spaces with advanced technology paired with Dolce sophisticated food and beverage program, offer an ideal combination for stimulating creativity. Whether it’s an award-winning golf courses, rejuvenating spas, or close proximity to the world’s most famous wineries, guests are drawn to Dolce for meetings, celebrations, and memory-making getaways. Source

item.title: Hawthorn
item.description: Stay Hawthorn. Stay as you are. With free WiFi, on-site laundry services, healthy breakfast options and fitness centers, Hawthorn Suites provides everything guests need to stay on track during extended stays. Each spacious suite includes a full kitchen with dishware, glassware and utensils provided. Source

item.title: Howard Johnson
item.description: Howard Johnson’s, or Howard Johnson by Wyndham, is an American chain of hotels and motels located primarily throughout the United States and Canada. It had also once been a chain of restaurants for over 90 years and its name was widely known for that alone. Founded by Howard Deering Johnson, it was the largest restaurant chain in the U.S. throughout the 1960s and 1970s, with more than 1,000 combined company-owned and franchised outlets.

item.title: Knights Inn
item.description: Knights Inn (officially Knights Franchise Systems, Inc.) is a full-limited service hotel chain owned by Red Lion Hotels Corporation and based in Denver, Colorado. Knights Inns used to be built with all-exterior corridors and medieval-inspired architecture, but the chain now has updated options for all Knights Inn properties. Source

item.title: La Quinta
item.description: Thanks to the exclusive Bright Morning Bed,® free Bright Side Breakfast® and spacious in-room work areas, La Quinta Hotels are a bright spot in every traveler’s journey. Source

item.title: Microtel
item.description: The Microtel Inn & Suites brand is a chain of franchise hotels with 343 locations with 24,947 rooms as of December 31, 2018. The company has locations in Argentina, Canada, Mexico, the Philippines, and the United States. Source

item.title: Ramada
item.description: Ramada is a large UA multinational hotel chain owned by Wyndham Hotels and Resorts. As of December 31, 2018, they operate 811 hotels with 114,614 rooms across 63 countries under the Ramada brand. Source

item.title: Super 8
item.description: With more than 2,800 hotels on four continents, the newly redesigned Super 8 offers affordable, innovative lodging on the open road. As your ultimate roadside companion, every location also offers free WiFi and a complimentary SuperStart Breakfast to get you recharged and refueled for the day ahead. Source Source

item.title: Travelodge
item.description: With many of Travelodge hotels conveniently located near national parks and landmarks, Travelodge provides a basecamp for adventure. Travelodge’s friendly service, affordable rates and free continental breakfasts ensure that guests are rested and refueled for their next expedition. Source

item.title: Tryp
item.description: Powered By The City. Tucked in the heart of the world’s greatest cities, TRYP by Wyndham is on the pulse of local hotspots and must-see sites— from the best restaurants, the coolest spots and the best ways to tap directly into the pulse of whatever city – big or small – you’re exploring. Source

item.title: Wingate
item.description: Wingate by Wyndham is a brand of independently owned hotels that targets business travelers. Wingate opened its first hotel in July 1996. Since then, over 100 new Wingate by Wyndhams have been opened. It competes with chains like Hilton Garden Inn, Courtyard by Marriott, and Hyatt Place. Wingate by Wyndham is a part of Wyndham Hotels & Resorts, formerly part of Cendant. In late 2007, Wingate Inn officially changed its name to Wingate by Wyndham.

item.title: Worldmark
item.description: WorldMark by Wyndham (formerly Trendwest) is the developer and marketer of WorldMark, The Club, a vacation ownership program and part of the Wyndham Worldwide Corporation. The original development partner of the Club was Trendwest International (TWI), a subsidiary of Jeld-Wenn Industries, a privately held door and window manufacturer. Source

item.title: Wyndham
item.description: Simply Comfortable. With locations worldwide, each aspect of a Wyndham hotel or resort is designed with one thing in mind – your comfort. Wyndham enthusiastic staff strives to meet your needs with a warm smile and can-do attitude make sure each and every one has a great stay. From welcoming lobbies, to thoughtfully designed, homey guest rooms with incredible sleep experiences, to well-equipped fitness centers, each space is carefully considered to ensure you feel right at home.

item.title: Wyndham Grand
item.description: Wyndham Grand’s beautiful destinations around the world combine premium amenities, restaurants, and spas with sophisticated architectural design to leave a lasting impression. From little luxuries that surprise and delight to friendly staff who go above and beyond, Wyndham Grand transforms ordinary experiences into unforgettable memories. Source

item.title: Conrad Hotels
item.description: Conrad Hotels & Resorts is an international brand of luxury hotels and resorts owned and operated by Hilton Worldwide. Conrad was considered the luxury flagship brand in the Hilton Family of Brands, named after company founder Conrad Hilton, until being supplanted by The Waldorf-Astoria Collection in 2006. As of December 31, 2018, it as 33 locations with 10,625 rooms, including two that are owned or leased with 778 rooms, 29 that are managed with 8,874 rooms, and two that are franchised with 973 rooms.

item.title: DoubleTree
item.description: DoubleTree by Hilton is an American hotel chain and a part of Hilton Worldwide. Most DoubleTree hotels are independently owned and operated by franchisees, but some are managed by Hilton Worldwide. Source

item.title: Hilton
item.description: Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc., formerly Hilton Hotels Corporation, is an American multinational hospitality company that manages and franchises a broad portfolio of hotels and resorts. Founded by Conrad Hilton in May 1919, the corporation is now led by Christopher J. Nassetta. Source

item.title: Holiday Inn
item.description: Holiday Inn is a British-owned American brand of hotels, and a subsidiary of InterContinental Hotels Group. Founded as a U.S. motel chain, it has grown to be one of the world’s largest hotel chains, with 1,173 active hotels and over 214,000 bedrooms as of September 30, 2018. The hotel chain’s headquarters are in Denham, Buckinghamshire. Source

item.title: Hyatt
item.description: Hyatt Hotels Corporation is an American multinational hospitality company that manages and franchises luxury hotels, resorts, and vacation properties. The Hyatt Corporation came into being upon purchase of the Hyatt House, at Los Angeles International Airport, on September 27, 1957. As of March 25, 2018, Hyatt has 777 properties in 54 countries. Fortune magazine ranked Hyatt #186 on its list of “America’s Best Employers” for 2018. Source

item.title: MGM Grand
item.description: The MGM Grand Las Vegas is a hotel and casino located on the Las Vegas Strip in Paradise, Nevada. The MGM Grand is the largest single hotel in the United States with 6,852 rooms. It is also the third-largest hotel complex in the world by number of rooms and second-largest hotel resort complex in the United States behind the combined The Venetian and The Palazzo. When it opened in 1993, the MGM Grand was the largest hotel complex in the world.

item.title: Sheraton
item.description: Sheraton Hotels and Resorts is an international hotel chain owned by Marriott International. As of December 31, 2018, Sheraton operates 441 hotels with 155,617 rooms globally, including locations in North America, Africa, Asia Pacific, Central and South America, Europe, the Middle East and the Caribbean. Source

item.title: Americ Inn
item.description: AmericInn provides genuine hospitality in 200 welcoming locations across the US. With free hot breakfast, updated guest rooms, on-site fitness centers and inviting indoor pools at select locations, AmericInn is proud to make all travelers feel like neighbors. Source

item.title: Days Inn
item.description: Days Inn is a hotel chain headquartered in the United States. It was founded in 1970 by Cecil B. Day, who opened the first location in Tybee Island, Georgia. The brand is now a part of the Wyndham Hotels & Resorts, headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey, which used to be a part of Cendant. As of December 31, 2018, Days Inn includes 1,728 locations worldwide with 137,678 rooms. Source
